0.name: purely functional programming
0.description: programming paradigm that treats all computation as the evaluation of mathematical functions

1.name: array programming
1.description: programming paradigm that generalize operations on scalars to apply transparently to higher-dimensional arrays

2.name: parallel computing
2.description: programming paradigm in which many calculations or the execution of processes are carried out simultaneously

7.name: reactive programming
7.description: programming paradigm focused on data flow and change propragation

9.name: generic programming
9.description: way of designing and writing programs where algorithms are written in terms of parametric types enabling easy reuse

10.name: dataflow programming
10.description: programming paradigm that models program as a directed graph of data flow between operations

12.name: constraint programming
12.description: programming paradigm wherein relations between variables are stated in the form of constraints

13.name: logic programming
13.description: programming paradigm based on formal logic

16.name: visual programming language
16.description: computer programming language to create programs by manipulating program elements graphically

18.name: stack-oriented programming
18.description: programming paradigm that relies on a stack machine model

20.name: functional reactive programming
20.description: programming paradigm for reactive programming using key features of functional programming

21.name: concurrent object-oriented programming
21.description: programming paradigm that combines object-oriented programming (OOP) together with concurrency

22.name: declarative programming
22.description: programming paradigm that expresses the logic of a computation without describing its control flow

24.name: object-oriented programming
24.description: programming paradigm based on the concept of objects

25.name: concurrent computing
25.description: form of computing in which several computations are executing during overlapping time periods

26.name: structured programming
26.description: programming paradigm aimed at improving clarity, quality, and development time by using control structures

28.name: imperative programming
28.description: type of programming paradigm in computer science

30.name: constraint logic programming
30.description: Programming paradigm which combines logic programming and constraint satisfaction

31.name: agent-oriented programming
31.description: programming paradigm centred on the concept of software agents

32.name: synchronous programming
32.description: programming paradigm supported by synchronous programming languages

34.name: reflective programming
34.description: ability of a process to examine and modify itself
